bala_mudiam wrote:

>
> Hi all,
>          I am new to heritrix.I downloaded the code today morning
> itself.I am able to use the web interface and create crawl jobs and
> able to run them but after i created some 3-4 jobs and tested them i
> am getting the follwing error in web interface like this :
>
>          An error occured
>
>          java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
>
>          java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
>
>          You may be able to recover by going back
>
> Can someone tell me how to solve the above problem?

Give heritrix a larger heap by doing something like the following when 
you start it: # JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx512m" ./bin/heritrix

(The default allocation is 256megs)

What scope are you using to crawl?  If its broadscope, OOMEs are 
expected: 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/releasenotes.html#1_0_0_limitations.

Another reason for your OOMEs may be the following. Each completed job 
keeps references to the main datastructures used crawling to make it so 
the UI can go back and look at configuration and logs of old jobs.  
Though these datastructures are emptied on job completion, these 
datastructures themselves occupy quite a lot of space in the heap.  You 
could restart Heritrix after every 3rd or 4th job completion.  This will 
clear the heap of the old job datastructures (We need to fix this aspect 
of our UI).

St.Ack
